text: I'm Jake Billo, and I'm director
for R&D Infrastructure

at Arctic Wolf. We have a
vulnerability management team

that qualifies and investigates
findings from third parties,

and they need to determine
whether it is a true security
incident or not.

We've built a solution
using AWS Config to allow

that team to independently
review the underlying resources
and help further their investigation.

With this solution, the
vulnerability management team can

view the complete history
of a resource such
as an IP address or domain name.

All of our workloads are
deployed as infrastructure
as code using AWS CloudFormation,

so there's tagging on the
underlying resources such
as Elastic Load Balancers.

This self-service capability
helps enterprise security truly
address their needs.
We are an existing AWS customer,
and it's crucial to capture the complete
history of a resource.

We also chose to build on AWS
to avoid undue maintenance
and operations effort.

With this solution, the
vulnerability management team can
advance a time sensitive investigation.

Something that might have
previously taken days now
only takes seconds.
Building on AWS means

that Arctic Wolf can use our
development resources more
efficiently and effectively.

It also means that we can take
advantage of managed services
where they make sense for the business.
